RACE.RACE_TEXT: FORT ERIE RACE 1 5F Dirt CR: 78. Claiming Purse 19800. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON THREE RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since July 28 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $6,250, if for $6,000, allowed 2 lbs. (Races Where Entered For $5,000 Or Less Not Considered In Allowances) (Colts And Geldings Preferred)(*Plus Up To $540 Ontario Bred/Ontario Sired Breeders Awards).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: ONE MORE RING broke poorly, was roused on the turn and from the five path at the top of the stretch proved best. CANT GLIDE BY KATZ was unhurried early, moved up on the turn and from the six path at the top of the stretch was second best. GUNZIG STINGER set a pressured pace and had a slim lead on the turn but from the three path at the top of the stretch had nothing left. BOUND LUCKY settled off the pace, trailed the field on the turn and finished well. ROYAL BIZ forced the pace and dueled on the turn but from the four path at the top of the stretch faded.

ENTRY.NAME: One More Ring
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke poorly, roused turn, 5-path stretch, proved best

ENTRY.NAME: Bound Lucky
ENTRY.OWNER: Beharry Vinodh H and Ceccato Sharon
ENTRY.COMMENT: settled off pace, trailed turn, finished well

ENTRY.NAME: Cant Glide by Katz
ENTRY.COMMENT: unhurried, moved up turn, 6-path stretch, 2nd best

ENTRY.NAME: Gunzig Stinger
ENTRY.COMMENT: set pressured pace, slim lead turn, 3-path stretch, nothing left

ENTRY.NAME: Royal Biz
ENTRY.COMMENT: forced pace, dueled turn, 4-path stretch, faded

RACE.RACE_TEXT: FORT ERIE RACE 2 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 69. Allowance Purse 24600. FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Other Than Claiming Since July 29 Allowed 2 lbs. (*Plus Up To $4,725 Ontario Bred/Ontario Sired Breeders Awa rds).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: HEADING WEST was in range, a factor on the turn and from the five path at the top of the stretch was kept to task. MAKES SENSE TO ME was in touch, roused on the turn and from the five path at the top of the stretch was up for place. ZIPPITY DAY was off the pace and had a mild gain on the turn but from the six path at the top of the stretch leveled off. ISA BREEZE was hustled early and dueled on the turn but weakened through the stretch. FLAT OUT ANGEL was well back, trailed the field on the turn and was not a factor. HERMIONE GRANGER showed speed from the outside and had a slim lead on the turn but from the three path at the top of the stretch gave way.

ENTRY.NAME: Makes Sense to Me
ENTRY.COMMENT: in touch, roused turn, 5-path stretch, up for place

ENTRY.NAME: Zippity Day
ENTRY.COMMENT: off pace, mild gain turn, 6-path stretch, leveled off

ENTRY.NAME: Flat Out Angel
ENTRY.COMMENT: well back, trailed turn, not a factor

ENTRY.NAME: Heading West
ENTRY.COMMENT: in range, factor turn, 5-path stretch, kept to task

ENTRY.NAME: Isa Breeze
ENTRY.COMMENT: hustled early, dueled turn, weakened

ENTRY.NAME: Hermione Granger
ENTRY.COMMENT: speed outside, slim lead turn, 3-path stretch, gave way

RACE.RACE_TEXT: FORT ERIE RACE 3 7F Turf CR: 59. Claiming Purse 15750. FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since July 29 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $5,000, if for $4,750, allowed 2 lbs. (Races Where Entered For $ 4,000 Or Less Not Considered In Allowances)(Limited to 8 Starters) (*Plus Up To $540 Ontario Bred/Ontario Sired Breeders Awards). If deemed inadvisable by management to run on the turf, this race will be run at a distance of Six and One Half Furlongs on t he main track.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: SEEDS OF GRANDEUR set the pace, had a clear lead on the far turn and from the three path at the top of the stretch fought gamely for the win. SILENT WARNING tracked the early leaders, was in tight on the far turn and vied through the stretch but was outgunned. MISS MOLLY LALOU was off the pace, saved ground on the far turn and was up for show. LUNATICA stalked the early leader and had a good position on the far turn but from the four path at the top of the stretch had no kick. MISS SCHILLER was rank early and had a mild gain on the far turn but had no impact.

ENTRY.NAME: Silent Warning
ENTRY.COMMENT: tracked leaders, in tight far turn, vied stretch, outgunned

ENTRY.NAME: Miss Schiller
ENTRY.COMMENT: rank early, mild gain far turn, no impact

ENTRY.NAME: Lunatica
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked leader, good position far turn, 4-path stretch, no kick

ENTRY.NAME: Miss Molly Lalou
ENTRY.COMMENT: off pace, saved ground far turn, up for show

ENTRY.NAME: Seeds of Grandeur
ENTRY.COMMENT: set pace, clear lead far turn, 3-path stretch, fought gamely

RACE.RACE_TEXT: FORT ERIE RACE 4 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 64. Maiden Special Weight Purse 21600. FOR MAIDENS, THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 122 lbs. (Colts And Geldings Preferred)(*Plus Up To $4,725 Ontario Bred/Ontario Sired Breeders Awards).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: VIDEO VIDA showed speed from the outside and set the pace, had a clear lead on the turn and was much the best. AUTUMN'S SO FLASHY was unhurried early and moved up on the turn but from the six path at the top of the stretch was no match for the winner. EIN WAHRER SOLDAT was in touch and hustled along on the turn but from the three path at the top of the stretch needed more. BEYOND TALENTED was in range and a factor on the turn but drifted out in mid stretch and faded. LITTLE DOMI was off the pace and had a mild gain on the turn but from the six path at the top of the stretch was no real threat. LETS SAY THIS stalked the early leader and was roused on the turn and has no response. STREET MAX had no speed, showed little and was never in contention.

ENTRY.NAME: Little Domi
ENTRY.COMMENT: off pace, mild gain turn, 6-path stretch, no real threat

ENTRY.NAME: Beyond Talented
ENTRY.COMMENT: in range, factor turn, drifted out mid stretch, faded

ENTRY.NAME: Street Max
ENTRY.COMMENT: no speed, showed little, never in contention

ENTRY.NAME: Autumn's So Flashy
ENTRY.COMMENT: unhurried early, moved up turn, 6-path stretch, no match

ENTRY.NAME: Lets Say This
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked leader, roused turn, no response

ENTRY.NAME: Ein Wahrer Soldat
ENTRY.COMMENT: in touch, hustled along turn, 3-path stretch, needed more

ENTRY.NAME: Video Vida
ENTRY.OWNER: Wagman Shale McClachrie Denyse and Bosscher Gayle
ENTRY.COMMENT: speed outside, set pace, clear lead turn, much the best

RACE.RACE_TEXT: FORT ERIE RACE 5 1 1/16M Turf CR: 82. Starter Optional Claiming Purse 23700. FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE STARTED FOR A CLAIMING PRICE OF $8,000 OR LESS SINCE AUGUST 29, 2021 OR CLAIMING PRICE $12,500. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race At A Mile Or Over Since July 29 A llowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $12,500, if for $12,000, allowed 2 lbs. (Races Where Entered For $10,000 Or Less Not Considered In Allowances) (Limited To 10 Starters)(*Plus Up To $810 Ontario Bred/Ontario Sired Breeders Awards). If deemed inadvisable by man agement to run on the turf, this race will be run at a distance of One mile and One Sixteenth on the main track.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: MONASTERY LANE was unhurried early, gained ground on the far turn and from the five path at the top of the stretch drew off. GLITTER BAY was in touch and had the lead on the far turn but with a clear lead in upper stretch failed to hold. AWILDAS TREASURE stalked the early leader and was a factor on the far turn but from the three path at the top of the stretch was all out. DOODLE DANDY was well back, closed the gap on the far turn and passed tired foes through the stretch. MORE SAVVY set the pace but chased on the far turn and had nothing left. PLUIE D'AVRIL was in range and raced evenly on the far turn but dropped back through the stretch.

ENTRY.NAME: Monastery Lane
ENTRY.COMMENT: unhurried early, gained ground far turn, 5-path stretch, drew off

ENTRY.NAME: Glitter Bay
ENTRY.COMMENT: in touch, led far turn, clear lead stretch, failed to hold

ENTRY.NAME: Pluie d'Avril
ENTRY.COMMENT: in range, evenly far turn, dropped back stretch

ENTRY.NAME: More Savvy
ENTRY.OWNER: Radcliffe Racing Stable and Admiral Stable
ENTRY.COMMENT: set pace, chased far turn, nothing left

ENTRY.NAME: Awildas Treasure
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked leader, factor far turn, 3-path stretch, all out

ENTRY.NAME: Doodle Dandy
ENTRY.OWNER: Hoad Lindsey L and Hoad Joseph B
ENTRY.COMMENT: well back, closed gap far turn, passed tired foes

RACE.RACE_TEXT: FORT ERIE RACE 6 5F Dirt CR: 70. Claiming Purse 19800. FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON THREE RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since July 29 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $6,250, if for $6,000, allowed 2 lbs. (Races Where Entered For $5,000 Or Less Not Considered In Allowances) (*Plus Up To $540 Ontario Bred/Ontario Sired Breeders Awards).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: NATASHA'S BIZNIZ set the pace, took command on the turn and was kept to task through the stretch. HONEY GIRL was in touch, had a mild gain on the turn and from the five path at the top of the stretch was second best. PASSION TO PLEASE was unhurried early and raced evenly on the turn but from the four path at the top of the stretch needed more. MY GIRL GABBY was off slow, trailed the field on the turn and was up for a share. PENNIESFROMABOVE was in range and roused on the turn but from the six path at the top of the stretch had no response. ONE LAST FLING stalked the early leader and was a factor on the turn but from the three path at the top of the stretch was empty.

ENTRY.NAME: Natasha's Bizniz
ENTRY.COMMENT: set pace, took command turn, kept to task

ENTRY.NAME: One Last Fling
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked leader, factor turn, 3-path stretch, empty

ENTRY.NAME: Honey Girl
ENTRY.COMMENT: in touch, mild gain turn, 5-path stretch, 2nd best

ENTRY.NAME: My Girl Gabby
ENTRY.OWNER: Warner, Nancy E. and Robert K.
ENTRY.COMMENT: off slow, trailed turn, up for share

ENTRY.NAME: Passion to Please
ENTRY.COMMENT: unhurried early, evenly turn, 4-path stretch, needed more

ENTRY.NAME: Penniesfromabove
ENTRY.COMMENT: in range, roused turn, 6-path stretch, no response

RACE.RACE_TEXT: FORT ERIE RACE 7 7F Turf CR: 83. Claiming Purse 22200. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NOT WON A RACE IN 2023 OR WHICH HAVE NEVER WON FOUR RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Claiming Price $8,000, if for $7,000, allowed 2 lbs. (Races Where Entered For $6,250 Or Less Not Considered In Eligibility) (Colts And Geldings Preferred)(Limited To 8 Starters)(*Plus Up To $540 Ontario Bred/Ontario Sired Breeders Awards). If deemed inadvisable by management to run on the turf, this race will be run at a distance of Six and One Half Furlongs on th e main track.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: UNION COLONEL set the pace, had a clear lead on the far turn and from the three path at the top of the stretch fought gamely for the win. SOCIETY JOE stalked the early leader and had a good position on the far turn but from the four path at the top of the stretch was outfinished. BEYOND BORDERS was unhurried early, moved up on the far turn and from the five path at the top of the stretch was up for a share. HIATUS tracked the early leaders from the inside, was a factor on the far turn and had a bid at the top of the stretch but had no late kick. BEYOND MY DREAMS was well back, trailed the field on the far turn and passed tired foes through the stretch. A I INITIATIVE was off the pace and had a mild gain on the far turn but from the four path at the top of the stretch leveled off. FOUR KNIGHTS was in touch and saved ground on the far turn but was not a factor. THE NEWFIE EXPRESS was in range but chased on the far turn and had no impact.

ENTRY.NAME: Beyond My Dreams
ENTRY.COMMENT: well back, trailed far turn, passed tired foes

ENTRY.NAME: Hiatus
ENTRY.OWNER: Voyce Jeff and McGirr Jr Herbert
ENTRY.COMMENT: tracked inside, factor far turn, bid top stretch, no late kick

ENTRY.NAME: The Newfie Express
ENTRY.COMMENT: in range, chased far turn, no impact

ENTRY.NAME: Society Joe
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked, good position far turn, 4-path stretch, outfinished

ENTRY.NAME: A I Initiative
ENTRY.COMMENT: off pace, mild gain far turn, 4-path stretch, leveled off

ENTRY.NAME: Four Knights
ENTRY.COMMENT: in touch, saved ground far turn, not a factor

ENTRY.NAME: Union Colonel
ENTRY.OWNER: Warner, Nancy E. and Robert K.
ENTRY.COMMENT: set pace, clear lead far turn, 3-path stretch, fought gamely

ENTRY.NAME: Beyond Borders
ENTRY.COMMENT: unhurried early, moved up far turn, 5-path stretch, up for share
